elements.title: Wilhelmine Key (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Wilhelmine Key (pictured) studied wasps as a child, and as an adult she kept them as pets?

elements.title: deadliest-ever UK theatre disaster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that C. J. Phipps, the leading theatre architect of the age, was found responsible for the deadliest-ever UK theatre disaster?

elements.title: Michelle Lyons (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Michelle Lyons has personally witnessed nearly 300 executions?

elements.title: Cartographers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 100-player board game Cartographers has a crowdfunded expansion set?

elements.title: Midwest Scientific (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Midwest Scientific was the only maker of microcomputers in Kansas City in the late 1970s?

elements.title: Philip Moger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Catholic bishop-elect Philip Moger knew that he wanted to become a priest when he was eight years old?

elements.title: West Side Story (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2021 film West Side Story was banned in the UAE, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Kuwait, Oman, and Bahrain, likely due to the transgender character Anybodys?

elements.title: Giriyak Stupa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to legend, Giriyak Stupa was constructed over the body of a dead goose?
